msContents.summary: Two separate documents are recorded on the recto and verso of this papyrus. The verso appears to be a much later composition, perhaps Roman-Byzantine.

msItemStruct.note: This papyrus previously had two inventory numbers (P.CtYBR inv. 193A and 193B), which have been consolidated into one.

Margins: Recto, Right
Verso, Right, bottom, left

The recto has a sheet join before right margin. The verso contains two partial columns: (col. i) 9 lines, right bottom margins, (col. ii) 2 lines, left margin.
Housed, but not yet conserved.

acquisition.p:
Acquisition Information, 1927: Purchased in Egypt on behalf of Yale, with funds that may have been donated by the General Education Fund of the Rockefeller Foundation's General Education Board. The dealers' names are given as Harold Idris Bell reported them in his 1927 report.
P.CtYBR inv. 168-212, and 2147-2154, were purchased by Francis Willey Kelsey and David L. Askren from Tadaros in Medinet el-Faiyum, late 1926 or early 1927. The manuscripts were brought to Yale from the British Museum between 9 May and 11 October 1927.

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

figure.note: Images of P.CtYBR inv. 193 are available at Yale University Library's Digital Collections website
